result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony David Amsden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Upon successful completion of probation term & completion of the Waushara County TAD Court, Court will grant expungement pursuant to s. 973.015.

Defendant is ordered to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD/Safe Streets Program.  Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony David Amsden

records.addlTxt: 10:39 am case called. Defendant Anthony David Amsden in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. No statement by the defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. If revoked the defendant would receive credit for 1 day served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,  Absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.Terms of Agent. Defendant is to participate and successfully complete the Waushara County TAD program-upon completion of TAD-court will grant expungement.  Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD-Attorney Caroline Ann Carver in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Carver states referral to TAD and awaiting assessment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on April 2, 2015 at 01:40 pm.

Case called @ 3:35 p.m. Defendant Anthony David Amsden in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information Stated. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 01:40 pm.

Case called @ 2:26 p.m. Defendant Anthony David Amsden in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Defendant Anthony David Amsden in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial.   Arraignment Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Arraignment scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on January 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Anthony David Amsden in court with attorney Colleen Bradley, both appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed. DA argues as to bond and the Court amend the start date of sentence to serve to be effective immediately rather than the just ordered report date of 1/5/15.  Argues for no contact provisions of cash bond as well.  SPD argues as to bond.   The Court:   Signature bond ordered w/conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  14CF-46:  Court addresses report date on jail sentence.  Previous good will extended was ill advised - sentence to commence forthwith subject to the same restrictions and courtesty previously extended as to Huber and GT credit.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
